alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Watch issued January 06 at 1:07PM PST until January 08 at 9:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures from 26 to 30 degrees possible. * WHERE...San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire. * WHEN...Late Sunday night through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...cold mornings will continue with widespread frost still possible Tuesday and Wednesday mornings.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
